title.#cdata-section: South Korea says North Korea fired several cruise missiles, adding to provocative weapons tests

description.#cdata-section: South Korea's military said Sunday that North Korea fired several cruise missiles that flew over waters near a major military shipyard on the country's eastern coast, extending a streak in weapons tests that are worsening tensions with the United States, South Korea and Japan.

enclosure.#cdata-section: In this photo provided by the North Korean government, North Korean leader Kim Jong Un attends a meeting held on Jan. 23 and 24, 2024 in North Korea. (Korean Central News Agency/Korea News Service via AP)

title.#cdata-section: Nazi death camp survivors mark 79th anniversary of Auschwitz liberation on Holocaust Remembrance Day

description.#cdata-section: A group of survivors of Nazi death camps will mark the 79th anniversary of the liberation of the Auschwitz-Birkenau camp during the Second World War in a modest ceremony Saturday in southern Poland.

enclosure.#cdata-section: The name of the Nazi death camp Auschwitz photographed at 'Gleis 17', Track 17, the memorial site for the train transportation from Berlin to the camp, on International Holocaust Remembrance Day in Berlin, Germany, Saturday, Jan. 27, 2024. The International Holocaust Remembrance Day marks the anniversary of the liberation of the Nazi death camp Auschwitz - Birkenau on Jan. 27, 1945. (AP Photo/Markus Schreiber)

title.#cdata-section: Donald Trump is on the hook for US$88.3 million in defamation damages. What happens next?

description.#cdata-section: For years, Donald Trump hurled insults at E. Jean Carroll, saying the advice columnist fabricated a sexual assault allegation against him to sell a book.

enclosure.#cdata-section: Republican presidential candidate former President Donald Trump speaks at a primary election night party in Nashua, N.H., Jan. 23, 2024. (AP Photo/Matt Rourke, File)

title.#cdata-section: More countries pause funds for UN Palestinian agency; Israel wants it replaced

description.#cdata-section: Britain, Italy, the Netherlands and Finland became the latest countries on Saturday to pause funding for the UN refugee agency for Palestinians (UNRWA), following allegations that some of its staff were involved in the Oct. 7 Hamas attacks on Israel.

enclosure.#cdata-section: Palestinians demonstrate against a gap in funding for UNRWA in Gaza City, on Sunday, Aug. 16, 2015. (AP Photo/Khalil Hamra)

title.#cdata-section: Biden returns to South Carolina to show his determination to win back Black voters in 2024

description.#cdata-section: U.S. President Joe Biden is spending this weekend in South Carolina, intent on driving home two messages: He’s loyal to the state that saved his campaign in 2020 and he’s determined to win back Black voters here and elsewhere who were central to his election last time but are less enthused this go-round.

enclosure.#cdata-section: FILE - President Joe Biden speaks Jan. 25, 2024, in Superior, Wis. Biden is campaigning this weekend in South Carolina, which holds its Democratic primary Feb. 3, with one eye squarely on the general election. (AP Photo/Alex Brandon, File)

title.#cdata-section: Trump praises Texas governor as border state clashes with Biden administration over immigration

description.#cdata-section: Former U.S. president Donald Trump lavished praise Saturday on Texas Gov. Greg Abbott for not allowing the Biden administration entry to remove razor wire in a popular corridor for migrants illegally entering the U.S. in an escalating feud over immigration.

enclosure.#cdata-section: Republican presidential candidate former President Donald Trump speaks at a campaign event Saturday, Jan. 27, 2024, in Las Vegas. (AP Photo/John Locher)

title.#cdata-section: Developers want to build America’s tallest skyscraper in an unlikely city

description.#cdata-section: A group of developers wants to construct what would be America’s tallest building in an unlikely place: Oklahoma City. The proposed location for the 1,907-foot “Legends Tower” is certainly unconventional. The skyscraper would be more than double the height of Oklahoma City’s tallest building now and the fifth-tallest building in the world.

enclosure.#cdata-section: Developers want to build a 1,907-foot skyscraper in Oklahoma City, part of a mixed-use development with apartments and retail called The Boardwalk at Bricktown. (Courtesy AO)

title.#cdata-section: After LA police raid home of Black Lives Matter attorney, a judge orders photographs destroyed

description.#cdata-section: A judge has ordered the Los Angeles Police Department to get rid of photographs of legal documents that officers allegedly took during an unannounced raid on the home of an attorney representing a prominent Black Lives Matter activist.

enclosure.#cdata-section: In this frame grab taken from video provided by attorney Dermot Givens, Los Angeles Police Department officers approach Givens with a copy of a search warrant outside his home, in Los Angeles, Tuesday, Jan. 23, 2024. (Dermot Givens via AP)

title.#cdata-section: U.S. condemns ban on Venezuelan opposition leader's candidacy and puts sanctions relief under review

description.#cdata-section: The U.S. government and nearly 30 conservative world leaders on Saturday condemned the decision of Venezuela's highest court to block the presidential candidacy of opposition leader Maria Corina Machado.

enclosure.#cdata-section: The U.S. government and nearly 30 conservative world leaders on Saturday condemned the decision of Venezuela's highest court to block the presidential candidacy of opposition leader Maria Corina Machado.

title.#cdata-section: 13 people injured when more than 40 vehicles crash on Chesapeake Bay bridge in Maryland

description.#cdata-section: Crashes involving more than 40 vehicles closed all lanes on the heavily-traveled U.S. 50 Bay Bridge in Maryland on Saturday, injuring 13 people and snarling traffic for about six hours, authorities said.

enclosure.#cdata-section: This image provided by the Maryland Transportation Authority shows a multi-vehicle crash on US-50 Bay Bridge in Maryland, on Saturday, Jan. 27, 2024. (Maryland Transportation Authority via AP)
